byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Baghdad, and Kareem Fahim from Kirkuk, Iraq, and Cairo. Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt from Washington; Falih Hassan, Omar Al-Jawoshy and Ahmad Salah from Baghdad; Kamil Kakol from Sulaimaniya, Iraq; and an employee of The New York Times from Mosul, Iraq.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Iraqi forces are regrouping and changing tactics against Islamic State militants, who continue to occupy parts of Tikrit and have caused high casualties among Iraqi troops; officials say next move is to gain western province of ISIS-controlled Anbar; offensive will then continue to Nineveh Province in north.
lead_paragraph: The hard lessons of the Tikrit offensive, which brought high casualties, have Iraqi officials thinking more cautiously about their next steps.

headline.main: Iraqi Forces Map Plan Against ISIS, With Strategic Use of Militias
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Forces Map Plan Against ISIS, With Strategic Use of Militias

snippet: The hard lessons of the Tikrit offensive, which brought high casualties, have Iraqi officials thinking more cautiously about their next steps.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
